Description: Foot and lower body sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup-skyphos; interior glazed with stamped decoration: enclosed ovules (not a full chain) surrounded by linked palmettes; exterior: black, reserved groove on lower wall, just above junction with foot; high, profiled ring foot; underside reserved with a thick band, two circles and a dot.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
D. W. J. Gill, Two Herodotean Dedications from Naukratis, Journal of Hellenic Studies, vol. 106 (1986), pp. 185-186.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 707, no. 649)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1539)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
